column4: I upgraded from 10.10 to 11.04, and now my touchpad scroll no longer works. Can someone help?
what make / model laptop?
HP Mini 311
it's a crucial piece of information for your question ;) please give full details in future
tried disabling touchpad tapping for click?
It did nothing.
is there a switch to enable / disable to pad?
Physical switch? No, there is not.
can also try: gconftool-2 --set /desktop/gnome/peripherals/touchpad/touchpad_enabled --type=bool true
or a shortcut key
There is no shortcut to disable the pad.
does the command I gave work?
The command did not fix the problem, no.
ok if you open a terminal and run:   xev     do the mouse keys make events?
The mouse keys do, but it is acting that there is no scroll whatsoever
i see
It worked on 10.10, so I don't know.
http://etano.net/2010/02/18/touchpad-not-working-hp-mini-311-solved/
That's more for the touchpad not responding whatsoever. It works, I can click, just not scroll.
might fix your issue too
I guess I'll be back in a few minutes then.
Still acting like there is no scroll.
are there bugs reported?
I have no idea.
